main event: An unidentified flying object was reported over Fairfax, Oklahoma on 2 November 1958. The object was described as very bright and approximately the size of a small passenger plane, changing direction and speed before disappearing from sight.
interesting points: The object was observed at an altitude of approximately 1000 feet and was moving at a speed of 50-100 MPH., The observer saw four orange colored discs in a low formation that hovered and started moving rapidly., The sighting lasted for about 5-6 seconds., No physical evidence or radar tracks were reported in the area during the sighting., The observer claimed the object was much larger and different in appearance from any known aircraft.
sighted object: four orange colored discs and a bright light
witness description: A reliable observer who reported seeing the object while traveling.
